text: The Benedictine abbey of Avenay, which was founded in 660 CE, was completely destroyed during the Revolution. The village of Avenay-Val-d’Or where it was located is eighteen miles south of Reims.
name: Avenay

text: Marie left Grenoble in early August 1672, after having traveled in the company of her sister Hortense, Duchesse Mazarin, since they had fled together from Rome on 29 May 1672. They went their separate ways after Grenoble—Marie to 'throw herself at the feet of the King' in Paris, and Hortense to take up residence in Chambéry as a guest of the Duc de Savoie, a former suitor of hers.
name: Grenoble
